prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band 3, C36-8, HD142527
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
Acquire high resolution low frequency continuum to search for structure in the dust traps of HD142527, which is unresolved in the ATCA observations, that have a beam of ~0.3arcsec along the ring. With a 0.1arcsec beam we can test for elongation of the continuum, as expected for a dust trap. Also, 0.1arcsec approximates the Hill sphere of a 60Mearth body, so that unresolved local peaks at such resolutions are indicative of on-going accretion.
The primary goal is the continuum.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: we target the continuum for 3 of the 4 spectral windows, but are also including one spw on HCO(1-0).

We require the finest angular resolutions possible to resolve structure in the ATCA clump.
The object is a ring with a 1arcsec radius, hence the need to recover ~2arcsec scales (see also the image synthesis artifacts in the science case).

The predicted peak intensity in the 87GHz for HD142527 is 0.4mJy/beam, so that this setup will provide adequate S/N ratio for spectral slopes estimates across spectral windows. In the event that the relative calibration of spectral windows is not accurate enough, we will tie the calibration to the observed SED.
The sensitivity requirement is driven by the continuum.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band 4, C36-7, HD142527
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note:
High frequency points for spectral analysis, in order to accurately extract the continuum temperature and optical depth.
We have included lines to attempt the detection of molecular emission in the dust trap.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We have two spectral windows on continuum, and two spectral windows on selected lines. The spectral resolution of the lines is the minimum for a centroid analysis.

We require the finest angular resolutions available in Band 3 to resolve structure in a Band3/Band4 spectral index map.
The object is a ring with a 1arcsec radius, hence the need to recover 2arcsec scales (see also the image synthesis artifacts in the science case).

The expected peak intensity is 1.5 mJy/beam, as estimated from the 87GHz predictions and the spectral slope at this frequency. With a S/N of order 30, we have enough accuracy for an accurate spectral index map, and separate the continuum temperature and optical depths in conjunction with band 3.
We cannot average the spectral line data further.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band 3, C36-8, MWC758
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Acquire high resolution low frequency continuum to search for structure in the dust traps of MWC758.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: This is single continuum, but we will perform an inter-spectral window spectral analysis.

We require the finest angular scales in Band3 to improve on the VLA resolutions (0.2arcsec beam).
The object is compact enough to alleviate the need for other configurations.

The expected flux density at 87GHz is 0.23mJy/beam in MWC758, according to our SED model (Marino et al. 2015). A S/N of 8 is at the limit of feasibility for extracting accurate spectral trends, and to attempt an estimate of the continuum optical depth - if this was insufficient given the frequency lever inside Band 3, we would revert to natural weights and a slightly coarser beam.
We chose an LO frequency as low as possible - without risking the edges of the window.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band 3, C36-6, HD142527
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Acquire intermediate resolution low frequency continuum to complement the uv coverage of C36-8.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We have chosen 3 continuum spectral windows as widely separated as possible, and a spw on line.
This configuration is meant to recover the larger scales in HD142527's ring, and also for the more diffuse HCO$^+$ emission (which is a broader ring).

We base this time estimate on the detection of HCO+(1-0), which is expected at 36mJy/beam.
The continuum should be at 3.6mJy/beam, which should be easily mapped with the bandwidth of a whole spectral window.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Band 4, C36-5, HD142527
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Compact configuration matched to C36-7 in band 4, to recover 2arcsec scales.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
we have chosen the coarsest spectral resolution possible to allow line detection.
Two spectral windows are placed at the top frequencies for continuum, so as to give broader frequency lever with Band 3.
This configuration is meant to recover power on 2arcsec scales.

The expected intensities are 13.5mJy/beam in a 0.3 arcsec beam at 158GHz, which should be easily achieved at high S/N. The total time of this OT goal is limited by overheads, but we require the corresponding angular scales.
We have two spectral windows on lines whose spectral resolution cannot be made any coarser.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Large-scale crescent-shaped continua imaged by ALMA in transition disks strongly suggest that azimuthal dust trapping is concentrating the larger grains. Indeed, thanks to ATCA and VLA observations we have discovered compact concentrations of cm-sized grains burried inside the larger-scale sub~mm emission in HD142527 and MWC758. With long-baseline resolutions in Cycle~3 we can 1- measure the key parameters responsible for the efficiency of dust trapping, 2- map the gas kinematics and so understand the origin of the pressure maxima where grains pile up, and 3- search for substructure in the dust trap maximum or deviations suggestive of on-going core-accretion.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Circumstellar disks, exoplanets and the solar system
